alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 6:07PM MST until September 12 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Slate Creek basin in... Gila County in east central Arizona... * Until 915 PM MST. * At 606 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Slate Creek and Cottonwood Creek basins. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Slate Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Slate Creek basin. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oak Spring Canyon. This includes the following highways... State Route 188 between mile markers 267 and 272. State Route 87 between mile markers 230 and 233. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get to higher ground immediately! Raging flash flood waters and debris will inundate residences near State Route 188 along the banks of Slate Creek. Turn Around, Don`t Drown! National Forest Service Road 26 and low water crossings through Slate Creek will be washed out and impassable. Flood waters may overtop State Route 188 as culverts become clogged from flood debris. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
